required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Rate+Extent of Excretion of Radioactivity in Urine+Faeces After Oral Administration of [14C]AZD1386
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Single Dose, Phase I Study of the Excretion of Radioactivity, Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics Following Oral Administration of [14C]AZD1386 to Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to get information about absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion as well as the tolerability and safety of AZD1386 in healthy male volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Excretion (rate+extent) of radioactivity in urine+faeces following oral administration of [14C]AZD1386
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until >90% of predicted total radioactivity has been recovered

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in plasma + unchanged AZD1386 in plasma Metabolite profile in plasma+excreta
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, + postdose 0.5h, 1h, 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 12h, 24h, 48h, 72h, 96h, 120h, 144hPredose + postdose 1h, 4h, 8h, 24h for excreta from predose (baseline) + postdose from 0h continously until 144h

secondary_outcome.measure: AZD1386 metabolites in plasma+excreta if feasable

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index of 18 - 30 and weight of 50 to 100 kilos.
- Healthy volunteer must have regular bowel movements (at least once daily)
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of psychiatric or somatic disease/condition, which may interfere with the objectives of the study as judged by the investigator.
- A family history of short QT syndrome or sudden cardiac death amongst first degree relatives.
- Any clinically important abnormalities in heart rhythm, conduction or morphology of resting ECG that may interfere with the interpretation of QTc interval changes.

overall_official.affiliation: AstraZeneca R&D, CPU Alderley Park, UK

responsible_party.name_title: Rolf Karlsten, MD, PhD, Medical Science Director, Emerging Analgesia, Neuroscience
